label: GIRLS AT HOMESTEAD ENTERTAIN AT DANCE

resource.chars:
GIRLS AT HOMESTEAD
ENTERTAIN AT DANCE

(Jirls at the Homestead entertain-
ed last Friday night at a dance at
their dormitory. Twenty young
collegiate misses and twenty-odd
young Oxford clad youths disported
themselves to the tunes of Carl Van
Sicklerâ€™s music. There was Charles
toning and less noisy dancing; there
was punch and food in generous
quantities.
Milly Woolman had charge of the
music. Emily Herzog was respon-
sible for the effectively decorated
rooms. Marcia Pierce saw that
everyone was fell-fed. And Frances
Maisch had charge of the Clean-Up
Squad that functioned after the fes-
tivities were over.
U. of M.
